meaning: निर्यान्तम् returning, भीमविक्रमम् of terrible prowess, राक्षसम् Rakshasas, धूम्राक्षम् Dhumraksha, वीक्ष्य seeing, सर्वे all, वानराः Vanaras, युद्धकाङ् क्षिणः desirous to wage war, प्रहृष्टाः rejoicing, विनेदुः made loud noise.
translation: Seeing Dhumraksha of terrible prowess returning, the vanaras made loud noises out of joy and desire to wage war.

meaning: घोरैः terrible, पादपैः trees, शूलमुद्गरैः tridents and clubs, अन्योन्यम् one another, निघ्नताम् , तेषाम् in that way, कपिरक्षसाम् between the Vanaras and Rakshasas, सुतुमुलम् tumultuous, युद्धम् war, संजज्ञे happened.
translation: Tumultuous war took place between Vanaras and Rakshasas, striking one another, monkeys with terrible trees and Rakshasas with tridents and clubs.

meaning: समन्ततः all over, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, घोराः fierce, वानराः Vanara, विनिकृत्ताः mowed down, राक्षसश्चापि even Rakshasas, वानरैः Vanara, द्रुमैः with trees, भूमिसमीकृताः pulled down to the ground.
translation: Fierce Rakshasas mowed down the Vanaras all over and even the Vanaras pulled down Rakshasas to the ground with trees.

meaning: राक्षसास्तु Rakshasas on their part, अभिसङ्क्रुद्धाः highly enraged, निशितैः sharp, घोरसङ्काशैः dreadful, कङ्कपत्रैः itching feathers, अजिह्मगैः fixed, शरैः arrows, वानरान् at Vanaras, विव्यथु attacked.
translation: Highly enraged Rakshasas on their part fixed the Vanaras with sharp dreadful arrows with itching feathers.

meaning: भीमाभिः being strong, गदाभिः wielding maces, पट्टसै: spikes, कूटमुद्गरैः multitude of weapons to crush, घोरैः terrific, परिघैश्च iron bars also, चित्स्रैः many kinds, संश्रितैः wielders, त्रिशूलैश्च tridents also, रक्षोभिः guarding, विदीर्यमाणाः knowers, महाबलाः endowed with prowess, तेवानराः those Vanaras, अमर्ष bearing, जनितोद्धर्षाः with great enthusiasm, अभीतवत् without fear, कर्माणि their duty, चक्रुः doing.
translation: The Vanaras although strong were wielding maces, spikes, tridents, terrific iron bars and multitude of weapons of many kinds to crush the Rakshasas. They were endowed with prowess, knowledgeable of weapons and doing their duty without fear and with great enthusiasm.

meaning: भीमाभिः being strong, गदाभिः wielding maces, पट्टसै: spikes, कूटमुद्गरैः multitude of weapons to crush, घोरैः terrific, परिघैश्च iron bars also, चित्स्रैः many kinds, संश्रितैः wielders, त्रिशूलैश्च tridents also, रक्षोभिः guarding, विदीर्यमाणाः knowers, महाबलाः endowed with prowess, तेवानराः those Vanaras, अमर्ष bearing, जनितोद्धर्षाः with great enthusiasm, अभीतवत् without fear, कर्माणि their duty, चक्रुः doing.
translation: The Vanaras although strong were wielding maces, spikes, tridents, terrific iron bars and multitude of weapons of many kinds to crush the Rakshasas. They were endowed with prowess, knowledgeable of weapons and doing their duty without fear and with great enthusiasm.

meaning: शरनिर्भिन्नगात्राः split necks and bodies, शूलनिर्भिन्नदेहिनः by the terrible tridents, ते they, वानरयूथपाः Vanara troops, तत्र there, द्रुमान् trees, शिलाश्च rocks, जगृहुः took up to fight.
translation: Vanaras 's bodies split in their necks by the terrible tridents, took up trees and rocks to fight.

meaning: भीमवेगाः of terrific speed, तेहरयः the monkeys, नर्दमानाः roaring, ततस्ततः proceeding from there, वीरान् heroes, राक्षसान् Rakshasas, ममन्थुः proclaiming नामानिच their names, बभाषिरे crushed.
translation: The monkeys endowed with terrific speed, proceeding from there roaring, proclaiming their names crushed the Rakshasa heroes.

meaning: विविधाभिः of several kinds, शिलाभिः rocks, बहुभिः many, पादपैः trees, तत् there, वानररक्षसाम् between Vanaras and Rakshasas, घोरम् fierce, युद्धम् war, अद्भुतम् च wonderful, बभूव took place.
translation: Wonderful fight took place between Vanaras and Rakshasas who held trees and rocks of several kinds.

meaning: जितकाशिभिः who conquered fear, वानरैः Vanaras, केचित् indeed, राक्षसाः Rakshasas, मथिताः crushed into lumps, केचित् indeed, रुधिरभोजनाः blood thrown out, मुखैः from mouth, रुधिरम् blood, ववमूः vomited.
translation: Vanaras who had conquered fear crushed Rakshasas into lumps of flesh indeed the Rakshasas threw out blood from their mouths.

meaning: केचित् some, पार्श्वेषु by the sides, दारिताः tore, केचित् some, द्रुमैः by trees, राशीकृताः crushed, केचित् some, शिलाभिः with rocks, चूर्णिताः powdered, केचित् some, दन्तै with teeth, विदारिताः tore into pieces.
translation: Some tore by the sides of the body, some crushed by the trees, some powdered by the rocks, and some were torn into pieces with teeth.

meaning: केचित् indeed, रजनीचरैः night rangers, विमथितैः killed, भग्नैः broken, ध्वजैः flags, विनिपातितैः crushed, खङ्गैश्च swords, विध्वंसितैः totally destroyed, रथैः chariots, पतितैः fallen down.
translation: Indeed, the night rangers were killed, their flags were broken. They were crushed, their swords were destroyed with chariots fallen.

meaning: वनौकसाम् monkeys, पर्वताग्रैः from mountain tops, मथितैः crushed, पर्वताकारैः like mountains in form, गजेन्द्रैः elephants, सारोहैः riders, वाजिभिः horses, वसुधातलम् surface of the ground, कीर्णम् covered.
translation: By the Vanaras hurling from the mountains, the crushed elephants were like mountains and the horses with riders crushed covered the ground all over.

meaning: भीमविक्रान्स्सैः of terrific valour, वेगितैः of high speed, वानरैः Vanaras, आप्लुत्य jumping up, राक्षसाः Rakshasas, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, करजैः nails, मुखेषु on the face, विनिर्तिताः wounded.
translation: The Vanaras with their terrific valour jumping up wounded the Rakshasas in their face with their sharp nails.

meaning: भूयः some others, विषण्णवदनाः pale faces, विप्रकीर्णशिरोरुहाः dishevelled hair, शोणितगन्धेन due to the smell of blood, मूढाः lost senses, धरणीतले on the ground, निपेतुः dropped.
translation: Some others with pale faces and dishevelled hair lost senses due to rolling in blood dropped on the ground.

meaning: भीमविक्रमाः of terrific valour, अन्ये others, राक्षसाः Rakshasas, परमसङ्कृक्रुद्धाः extremely enraged, वज्रस्पर्शसमैः of hard touch like diamond, तलैरेव with palms, हरीन् monkeys, अभिधावन्ति assailed.
translation: Other Rakshasas of terrific valour, extremely enraged, hit the monkeys with their palms which were hard as diamond to touch.

meaning: वेगिताः endowed with speed, आपतन्तः falling upon, ते them, वेगवत्तरैः of greater speed, वानरैः Vanaras, मुष्टिभिः with fists, चरणैः feet, दन्स्सैः with teeth, पादपैश्च trees also, अवपोथिताः knocking.
translation: Endowed with speed, the Vanaras also fell on the Rakshasas at greater speed, knocking them down with fists, feet, teeth and even trees.

meaning: राक्षसर्षभ bull among Rakshasas, धूम्राक्षः Dhumraksha, विद्रुतम् distressed, सैन्यम् army, दृष्टवा seeing, रोषेण angrily, युयुत्सताम् eager to fight, वानराणाम् Vanaras, कदनम् havoc, चक्रे running away.
translation: Dhumraksha, the bull among the Rakshasas seeing the army distressed and running away, being eager to fight began to cause havoc to the Vanaras.

meaning: केचित् a few, वानराः Vanaras, प्रासैः by barbed darts, प्रमथिताः mutilated, शोणितस्रवाः, केचित् , मुद्गरैः, आहताः, धरणीतले on the ground, पातिताः dropped.
translation: Few Vanaras mutilated by barbed darts, some struck with mallets, blood oozing dropped down.

meaning: केचित् some, परिघैः iron bars, मथिताः pounded, भिण्डिवालैः torn up, विदारिताः split, केचित् some, पट्टसैः pierced, मथिताः pounded, विह्वलन्तः cut, गतासनः ceased of life.
translation: Some were pound by iron bars, some were torn up, some split and some pierced and cut ceased in life.

meaning: युधि in the battlefield, केचित् some, वनौकसः Vanaras, सङ्क्रुद्धैः attacked by, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, विनिहताः killed, रुधिरार्द्राः floating in blood, भूमौ on the ground, एचित् some, विद्राविताः split, नष्टाः destroyed.
translation: In the battlefield some Vanaras, attacked by Rakshasas, were floating on the ground in blood, dead.

meaning: केचित् a few, विभिन्नहृदयाः hearts open and broken, एकपार्श्वेन beaten on one side, शायिताः laid, केचित् few, त्रिशूलैः by tridents, विदारिताः split, आन्स्रैः inner parts, विनिःसृताः detached.
translation: Some with their hearts open and broken, beaten on side laid detached of their inner parts.

meaning: सुभीमम् very frightful, हरिराक्षससङ्कुलम् monkeys and Rakshasa groups, शिलापादमसङ्कुलम् with rocks and trees, शब्दबहुलम् loud noise, महत् great, तत् युद्धम् that battle, प्रबभौ abounded.
translation: The monkeys and Rakshasa groups took part in a fierce fight with rocks and trees abounding loud noise.

meaning: धनुर्ज्यातन्त्रिमधुरम् in the form of twang of bow strings, हिक्कातालसमन्वितम् neighing of horses in the form of wooden cymbals, मन्धस्न्तितसङ्गीतम् music in the form of trumpeting of elephants, तत् that, युद्धगान्धर्वम् , आबभौ seemed.
translation: It seemed like music in the form of twang of bow strings, neighing of horses like the sound of wooden cymbals, vocal music in the form of trumpeting of elephants, that battle seemed like symphony.

meaning: धूम्राक्षस्तु Dhumraksha with bow in hand, रणमूर्धनि in the battle front, धनुष्पाणिः wielding arrows and bow, हसन् laughing, शरवृष्टिभिः showers of arrows, तान् वानरान् on the Vanaras, दिशः directions, तु at, विद्रावयामास started dispersing.
translation: Dhumraksha with his bow in hand, showering arrows, laughing in battlefront dispersed the Vanaras in directions.

meaning: मारुतिः Hanuman, धूम्राक्षेण at Dhumraksha, अर्धितम् perturbed, व्यथितम् harassed, सैन्यम् army, प्रेक्ष्य beholding, सङ्क्रुद्धः very angry, विपुलाम् huge, शिलाम् rock, प्रगृह्य grabbing, अभ्यवर्तत turned towards.
translation: Beholding the perturbed army, Hanuman seized a huge rock and turned towards Dhumraksha.

meaning: पितृ father:, तुल्यपराक्रमः endowed with mighty valour, क्रोधात् angrily, द्विगुणताम्राक्षः copper colour red eyed, धूम्राक्षस्य at Dhumraksha, रथंप्रति at the chariot, तांशिलाम् that rock, पातयामास hurled.
translation: Endowed with mighty valour equal to his father, an angry Hanuman hurled the rock at the chariot of Dhumraksha.

meaning: आपतन्तीम् descending upon, शिलाम् rock, दृष्टवा beholding, सम्भ्रमात् bewildered, गदाम् mace, उद्यम्य seizing, वेगेन rushing, रथात् chariot's, आप्लुत्य mounting, वसुधायाम् on the ground, व्यतिष्ठत stood
translation: Beholding the rock descending upon him, Dhumraksha rushed instantly on the ground from the chariot and stood.

meaning: साशिला that rock, तस्य its, सचक्रकूबरसाश्वम् with wheel and axle, सध्वजम् with posts, सशरासनम् with arrows, रथम् chariot, प्रमध्य crushed, भुवि ground, निपपात Fell.
translation: That rock fell on the chariot and got crushed along with its wheel and axle and with arrows.

meaning: मारुतात्मजः son of WindGod, सःहनुमान् that Hanuman, तस्य his, रथम् chariot, भङ् क्त्वा trunks, सस्कन्धविटपैः stems of trees, द्रुमैः Dhumraksha, रक्षसाम् Rakshasa, कदनम् destruction, चक्रे started.
translation: Hanuman the son of WindGod in that way started destroying the chariot and the Rakshasa with tree trunks and stems.

meaning: राक्षसाः Rakshasa, विभिन्नशिरसः heads broken, भूत्वा hit, शोणितोक्षिताः drenched in blood, अन्ये other, द्रुमैः trees, प्रमथिताः hit by, धरणीतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell.
translation: Some Rakshasas hit by trees with their heads broken, shedding blood fell on the ground.

meaning: मारुतात्मजः the son of Wind God, हनुमान् Hanuman, राक्षसम् at Rakshasas, सैन्यम् army, विद्राव्य chasing, गिरेः mountain, शिखरम् top, आदाय reaching, धूम्राक्षम् Dhumraksha, अभिदुद्रुवे jumped on to.
translation: Hanuman the son of WindGod, after chasing the army of Rakshasas reaching the top of the mountain, jumped on Dhumraksha.

meaning: वीर्यवान् heroic, धूम्राक्षः Dhumrakshasa, गदाम् mace, उद्यम्य lifting up, विनर्दमानः roaring like a lion, सहसा brave, आपतन्तम् jumped, तंहनूमन्तम् that Hanuman, अभिद्रवत् darted.
translation: Lifting his mace on seeing Hanuman, heroic and brave Dhumraksha darted on Hanuman, roaring like a lion.

meaning: अथ and then, धूम्राक्षः Dhumraksha, बहुकण्टकाम् fixed with many nails, तांगदाम् that mace, क्रुद्धस्य enraged, तस्यहनूमतः that Hanuman's, मस्तके head, रोषेण in anger, पातयामास alighted.
translation: And then lifting his mace fixed with many nails, Dhumraksha enraged lighted on Hanuman.

meaning: तत्र there, भीमवेरूपया of fierce form, तया like that, गदया mace, ताडितः fell, सः he, मारुतबलः equal to WindGod in strength, सःकपिः that monkey, तम् that, प्रहारम् hurt, अचिन्तयन् without caring, धूम्राक्षस्य Dhumraksha's, शिरोमध्ये middle of the head, गिरिशृङ्गम् peak of the mountain, अपातयत् dropped.
translation: That fierce mace fell on Hanuman's head. Hanuman who was equal to wind god without caring for the hit dropped the peak of the mountain on the centre of Dhumraksha's head.

meaning: गिरिशृङ्गेण by the peak of the mountain, ताडितः falling, सः he, विस्फारितसर्वाङ्गः all limbs broken to pieces, सहसा along with, विकीर्णः crushed, पर्वतःइव like a mountain, भूमौ on the ground, पपात fell.
translation: By the falling of the peak of the mountain on Dhumraksha, all his limbs broken to pieces and crushed fell on the ground like a mountain.

meaning: हतशेषाः those who survived, निशाचराः night rangers, धूम्राक्षम् Dhumraksha, निहतम् killed, दृष्टवा seeing, त्रस्ताः out of fear, प्लवङ्गमैः of Vanaras, वध्यमानाः killed, लङ्काम् into Lanka, प्रविविशुः reentered.
translation: Those Rakshasas who survived the onslaught, seeing Dhumraksha killed, reentered Lanka out of fear of being killed by Vanaras.

meaning: महात्मा great soul, सः he, पवनसुतः son of wind god, शत्रुम् enemy, निहत्य killing, क्षतजवहाः in the battlefield, परितश्च made to flow, संनिकीर्य river of blood, रिपुवधजनितश्रमः exhausted by killing the enemies, कपिभिः even the monkeys, सुपूज्यमानः started worshipping, मुदम् in joy, आगमत् felt.
translation:
The son of wind god, the great soul, having killed the enemy in the battlefield and making the river of blood to flow, was exhausted by killing enemies. The monkeys started worshipping him in joy.
।। इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेद्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः ।।
This is the end of the fifty second sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
